data.title: Chhattisgarh state came into existence on 1st November 2000.
data.caption: The total population of the state (according to Census year 2011) is 255.45 lakhs. The population of Scheduled Tribes is 78.22 lakh, and the population of Scheduled Castes is 32.47 lakh.The concept of tribal sub plan for the development of Scheduled Tribes in the state is in progress. The main tribe is Gond and its sub castes - Madia, Muria, Dorla etc. In addition, there are a large number of Uraon, Kanwar, Binjwar, Bagga, Bhadra, Kamar, Halba, Sewra, Nagasiya, Mazwar, Kharia and Dhanwar tribes. In the state of Chhattisgarh, 5 special backward tribes, Bagga, Kamar, Hill Korba, Birhor, Aboujmadia, are residing. Keeping in view their economic social and regional development, 6 Backward Tribal Development Agency is formed in the state.

data.title: AFI Cancels Birth of a Nation Screening, Nate Parker Q&A
data.caption: The American Film Institute has canceled its Friday screening of “Birth of a Nation,” which was to be followed by a Q&A with filmmaker and star Nate Parker, whose 1999 rape case has put the filmmaker and distributor Fox Searchlight on the defensive this past week.

data.title: Horror Movie ‘Don’t Breathe’ to Scare Off ‘Suicide Squad’ for No 1 Spot

data.title: Dream Getaways: Celebrity Couples' Luxurious Vacation Homes
data.caption: Who needs one house when you can have two?!  Celebrity couples already live a life of luxury in their everyday mansions, but some husband and wives opt to purchase another home for when they feel like getting away on vacation.
